There's an explanation for the password required comments. What I downloaded was a single password protected 1.5GB RAR file. This is the first time I got one of those.

I checked here Sunday shortly after this episode of Top Gear finished airing and saw a torrent of this name. I started downloading briefly but then paused it. That torrent was NOT uploaded by sceneline but had this torrent's name. This morning I saw this torrent and downloaded the torrent file. Having the same name, the previous torrent restarted.

So the password-required RAR file scam apparently is about quickly uploading a fake torrent with a commonly formatted name and then either removing it when the real torrent is uploaded, or having the fake torrent get deleted.

So go easy on the outraged commentators. It really did happen.
Works perfectly. Thankyou.
